def_en: May is the fifth month of the year in the Western calendar.

def_cn: 也许(会发生或出现);可能(会如此)
def_en: You use may to indicate that something will possibly happen or be true in the future, but you cannot be certain.

def_cn: 有可能，也许(用于表示某事可能属实，但不确定)
def_en: You use may to indicate that there is a possibility that something is true, but you cannot be certain.

def_cn: 也许，可能(用于表示某事有时或在某些情况下属实)
def_en: You use may to indicate that something is sometimes true or is true in some circumstances.

def_cn: (与过去分词连用，用于表示有可能已经发生、属实或给出一个可能的解释)
def_en: You use may have with a past participle when suggesting that it is possible that something happened or was true, or when giving a possible explanation for something.

def_cn: 尽管，或许(用于承认情况属实，但同时与更重要的事情作比较)
def_en: You use may in statements where you are accepting the truth of a situation, but contrasting it with something that is more important.

def_cn: 可以(用于举出在需要时可以加以利用的某些特性、事实等)
def_en: You use may when you are mentioning a quality or fact about something that people can make use of if they want to.

def_cn: (通常根据规则或法律)可以/不可以
def_en: You use may to indicate that someone is allowed to do something, usually because of a rule or law. You use may not to indicate that someone is not allowed to do something.

def_cn: 可以(表示准许或请求许可)
def_en: You use may when you are giving permission to someone to do something, or when asking for permission.
You use may when you are making polite requests.

def_cn: 可以,能否（通常用于问句中，表示提出礼貌的建议、请求等)
def_en: You use may, usually in questions, when you are politely making suggestions or offering to do something.

def_cn: 可以(用于有礼貌地插话、提问或引入话题等)
def_en: You use may as a polite way of interrupting someone, asking a question, or introducing what you are going to say next.

def_cn: 也许会，可能会(用于提及别人对自己所说的话可能会有的反应或态度)
def_en: You use may when you are mentioning the reaction or attitude that you think someone is likely to have to something you are about to say.

def_cn: 不妨说,可以说(用于强调)
def_en: You use may in expressions such as I may add and I may say in order to emphasize a statement that you are making.

def_cn: (以便)能，可以（使某事发生）
def_en: If you do something so that a particular thing may happen, you do it so that there is an opportunity for that thing to happen.
People sometimes use may to express hopes and wishes.
be that as it may→see: be;  may as well→see: well;
